title: Q&A Chat Assistant
description: An AI chatbot that answers legal help questions for users or volunteers, offering conversational support.

children.text: This idea envisions an AI-powered assistant that answers legal questions conversationally, either directly to the public or as a co-pilot for junior staff.
Stakeholders identified existing tools like Ask ILAO, Amigo, and North Carolina’s LIA. Evaluation standards include accuracy, completeness, and testing against real-world use.
Respondents were supportive, but cautious about going public-facing without clear safeguards. Interest was especially high in copilots for volunteers.

title: Search, Triage, and Resource Matching
description: An AI triage system that asks intake questions and matches users to the right resources, legal guides, or service organizations.

children.text: This AI system helps users find the right information or legal service by asking structured intake questions and filtering based on need and eligibility.
Existing work includes Michigan’s Guide to Legal Help and various chatbot pilots. Evaluation focuses on successful referrals and user engagement.
Stakeholders noted data and eligibility logic as limiting factors, but strongly supported collaboration and saw this as the highest-priority task.
